intro: Hydrochorea acreana, commonly known as the water lily of the Amazon, is a striking aquatic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It features broad, floating leaves that provide shade and habitat for various aquatic organisms. The plant produces showy, white or pink flowers that bloom during the day and close at night. Its roots anchor in the muddy bottom of water bodies, while its rhizomes spread horizontally to form dense colonies. Hydrochorea acreana plays a vital role in maintaining water quality and supporting biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
